name: Blue Waters Antigua

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at Blue Waters for a week in February and found it decidedly mediocre. The beaches were tiny and (I would guess) man made. The pools were very ropey and the food was absolutely awful! we booked a sea front room but had read previous reviews so werent expecting anything spectacular. However the only view from our balcony was a mass of palm trees and a tiny bit of sky. Pretty enough but certainly not a sea view and I resent paying extra for something we didnt get. In the end we changed rooms after the first night anyway as we were in the block closest to the bar and live music disturbed us and our 5 year old until 11pm the first night. Not late for some Im sure but when we knew our daughter would wake up in the early hours due to jet lag we desperately wanted our sleep. There is live muisc in, or outside, the bar every evening until 11 so if you like early nights or at the least peace and quiet to listen to the sounds of nature around you, this is not the hotel for you.
reviews.title: mediocre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Palms resturant was tatty and terribly understaffed. Our experience of breakfast and lunch on the first day convinced us to go further afield for supper and we ate in some fantastic resturants in St Johns and Runnaway Bay- The Coconut Grove and Papa Zouks being particularly good.
reviews.title: I'm loving it loving it and loving it more!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean but small and the air conditioning stopped working 3 times during our stay . Each time I reported it and the reception staff said they would send maintenance to fix it. Nobody ever arrived and eventually it would start again spontaneously after about 2 -3 hours. By the third episode I realised reception guessed it would fix itself eventually and clearly had no intention of sending anyone.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel For A Quiet Relaxing Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In summary a pretty run down, uninspiring hotel. If you've never stayed in a good four star hotel before and never been to a tropical island before it may be to your taste but it compares poorly to a number of other hotels we've stayed in and I would certainly never returnn nor recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Wonderful privacy in Cove Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is amazing! I love everything about it! Definately 5 star. I love this place so much I've been there 10 times, and hoping to come again!The people are so nice and helpful, to me they're family. They've known known me since I was 2, and been amazing to me all the time. I would die to back there, I want to live there, but I dont have much money. I reccommend going to Rock cottage, it's a beauty. Everything's great about the place, it's a right beauty!
reviews.title: Fabulous honeymoon resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived and were greeted by the manager (Alastair) to the moment we left the staff were incredibly welcoming, professional, friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: The best and most friendly service in over 30 years of travelling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife Louise is disabled and uses a wheelchair so getting the right hotel environment can be a major challenge.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Caribbean Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Unfortunately we had booked a room where life was going to be incredibly difficult and the holiday could have been a disaster.Thankfully right from our first meeting Alistair made sure that we knew if anything was a problem they were keen to hear about it quickly and to address it wherever possible.
reviews.title: Very Relaxing Week

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: As a result we ended up relocating to the recently built Cove Suites and had the most amazing time.
reviews.title: Average at best, not worth the high price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: The rooms are incredibly luxurious and spacious with large bathrooms and a massive bedroom/sitting area. Through our large double doors we had our own terrace which looked out onto a lovely quiet pool area shared with a maximum of 6 other apartments. All this in a setting with beautiful ocean views.Oh and someone who pops by throughout each day to get you drinks (lovely cocktails!) and food.
reviews.title: Another Caribbean rip-off! Unless your there for the cricket...go to Asia!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent one week at the Cove suites in Blue Waters. They all have waterview and are really new and beautifly decorated. Huge bathroom, huge king size bed and a large sitting area as well as balcony that opens up to paradise! The check-in was awesome. We didn't even have to stand at the desk, they came over to us with a rum punch and a cool cloth and they checked in for us. We chose to do all inclusive and the mini-bar in the room was included with that as well. We ate at the Palm restaurant and the Cove. unfortunatly Vivieyens was closed while we were there so there was no place to eat in air conditioning. For breakfast, there was a buffet with eggs, omlets, pancakes, french toast made to order. There was also cereal, yougurt, oatmeal, fruit, cheeses, and baked goods. For lunch they had a buffet that was different each day, but you can also order off the a la cart menu. Dinner was good in both restaurants as well as the cocktails. The hotel was only about 30% full when we were there so we felt we got excellent service. I would highly reccomend this hotel to others.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008
reviews.text: We got married November 4th at Blue Waters. It was wonderful!
reviews.title: Fabulous Wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were 27 people with us and not one person complained. The food was lovely, the staff were very friendly and helpful. We stayed in the Cove suites. They are gorgeous. The wedding was lovely, we got married under the gazebo which was decorated and chairs were all put out for the guests. We then had our wedding reception in the pool at the side which meant nobody could get in or stand around watching, it was completely private. We had an amazing band and also Mr Moves! He was fantastic!
reviews.title: Can't wait to return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa looked nice and i think many people used it however i didnt so cant really reccommend, I took my own make-up and hair artist as well as own photpgrapher. However we did also use their photgrapher also, he was ok but not amazing and the Dvd was ok.
reviews.title: Very nice but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will certainly be returning, It is not a place for party people but having said that there were 29 of us all in 20s and we all had such a good time
reviews.title: 5*Cove Suites and delicious food - we'll be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband and I went to Blue Waters in October half term with our two children aged 9 and 12. We stayed in The Cove Suites, private from the main Hotel with our own infinity pool. The hotel was spotless, the staff were friendly and very helpful, the food was great and we did the all inclusive package as we had the children, they were very satisfied. The whole place was great and nothing was too much trouble. A very relaxing and fantastic holiday. I'd recommend it to couples and families alike.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Blue Waters for our honeymoon and had the best time. It was more beautiful than we expected and the service was excellent. As soon as we arrived to Blue Waters, we were handed a glass of rum punch. The manager, Alistair, came out to introduce himself, and then we were given the tour and shown to our room. A few minutes later there was a knock at the door and a lady was giving us a complimentary bottle of champagne! Everyone was very welcoming and made us feel right at home. We stayed in the Deluxe Beachfront Suites, which has an amazing view of the water. The waves crashed against the rocks a few feet in front our balcony so it was nice to lie in bed and hear the waves. Our room was very close to the beach and all of the pools. Very clean and roomy.
reviews.title: Absolutely AMAZING!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We chose not to do all-inclusive because we like to venture into the city and experience the nightlife and restaurants. Breakfast and Afternoon Tea was still included. We had a very nice lunch at the resort one day. On the weekends, a steel drum band would play during lunch and in the evenings. The tea was fabulous as well. One night we had dinner at The Cove, which was very nice and had excellent food.
reviews.title: Great hotel to relax in and get away from everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had been told to try Coconut Grove for dinner so the front desk called us a cab and it was a 15 minute cab ride. The cab drivers were very friendly and happy to tell us about the different sights. If you've never been to see the sunset at Shirley Heights, I would take the 45 minute shuttle from the hotel on Sunday evening. They have a big BBQ with really, really good food and a steel drum band. A reggae band plays after it gets dark.
reviews.title: Great Relaxing Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most of our time we spent lounging by the pool and beach all day. We took the sea kayaks out and went out to some of the small private beaches around the cove. We loved swimming out to the floating dock and lounging in the sun.
reviews.title: Save Your Money

description: Nestled in the North West Corner of Antigua where crystal clear waters lap onto secluded white sand beaches, Blue Waters Resort offers an island paradise. From your personal welcome, complete with cooled scented towel and rum punch, you will realise you are our valued guest. Featuring small secluded beach coves, seven freshwater pools and 17 acres of lush tropical gardens, Blue Waters provides the ideal setting for relaxing days by the pool or on the beach, cocktail in hand, or for reading a good book in the shade of the swaying palm trees. Having gently evolved and constantly improved over 50 years we offer a range of luxuriously appointed rooms to meet the needs of our guests, from hillside rooms in a garden setting to beachside rooms with renowned spectacular ocean views. For the more active guest we offer complimentary watersports, tennis and a newly refurbished gym. Our recently opened Elemis Spa and Hair Salon with its stunning ocean views provides a perfect setting for a pampering treatment or as part of a wedding package. Finish the day off dining at one of our 3 restaurants, each with a different ambience to suit your mood. Our staff is ready and waiting to welcome you.
